intro: Euphrasia immaculatae-conceptionis, commonly known as the Immaculate Conception Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and produces small, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
